text: The Party of Tatar National Independence İttifaq or Ittifak (, ) is a political party. ==History== It was founded in the Tatar ASSR in April, 1990, and officially registered on January 3, 1992.http://guides.rusarchives.ru/browse/guidebook.html?bid=23&sid;=319930 Ittifaq was the first non-communist party in Tatarstan. It is commonly referred to as a Tatar nationalist party. It was named in honour of Ittifaq al-Muslimin, a pre-revolutionary Muslim political party represented in the parliament (Duma) of the czarist Russia. ==Goals== The goals, as claimed by the party, are: * revival of the Tatar nation * restoring Tatar statehood * recognition of the Tatar state as an international entity. ==Leadership== The permanent leader of the Ittifaq party is Fäwziä Bäyrämova. She has been leading the party for more than 20 years. ==Publications== The party published its own newspaper - Altın Urda - from 1993 to 1998.Татар милли бәйсезлек партиясе "Иттифак" == References == Category:Tatarstan Category:Nationalist organizations in Europe Category:1990 establishments Category:Political parties in Russia
title: Ittifaq Party
